mcq.questionText: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: Digestion is completed in part C.
No digestion takes place in part A.
No digestive juice is found in part B.
Digested food is absorbed into the blood in part D.

mcq.questionText: Which of the following is correct?

options.text: Skeletal - Brain - To protect our main organs.
Muscular - Muscles - To give our body its shape.
Circulatory - Heart - To pump blood to the rest of the body.
Respiratory - Blood - To transport waste materials away from different parts of the body.

mcq.questionText: Which of the following is correct?

image.caption: Amount of undigested food leaving each organ after a meal

options.text: A - D - B - E
B - C - D - A
E - B - C - D
B - E - A - D

mcq.questionText: Which of the following tests can help determine which student is correct?

options.text: To find out if substance X has mass.
To find out if substance X can be compressed.
To find out if substance X has a definite shape.
To find out if substance X has a definite volume.

mcq.questionText: Which of the following correctly shows the amount of air in the container at the end of the experiment and the explanation of the results?

image.caption: Sealed metal container with water and air

options.text: 30 cm³ - Air can be compressed.
30 cm³ - Air has no definite volume.
40 cm³ - Air can be compressed.
40 cm³ - Air has no definite volume.

mcq.questionText: Based on the observation above, which statement is correct?

image.caption: Two objects, X and Y, placed on a beam balance

options.text: Y has a greater mass than X.
Y has a greater volume than X.
Both X and Y are made of the same material.
Objects with smaller mass, have smaller volume.

mcq.questionText: Which one of the following is a source of light?

options.text: a lit lamp
an apple
a mirror
the moon

mcq.questionText: Which is the correct reason for her observation?

options.text: Light can be reflected.
Light cannot be blocked.
Light is a form of energy.
Light travels in a straight line.

mcq.questionText: How is Darwin able to see the picture?

image.caption: Diagram of Darwin seeing a picture

options.text: The picture gives off light and enters his eyes.
The light reflects the picture and enters his eyes.
The light enters his eyes and reflects on the picture.
The light falls on the picture and gets reflected into his eyes.

short_answer.questionText: Larry carried out an experiment to find out how the size of the food cube affects the time taken for it to be completely digested. Each set-up contains the same amount of digestive juices and the same amount of food.

subQuestions.text: (a) What is the changed variable in this experiment?
(b) Based on the information given, what is the relationship between the time taken for all the food to be completely digested and the size of the food cube?
subQuestions.modelAnswer: As the size of the food increases the time taken for all the food to be completely digested increases.

subQuestions.text: (c) Explain how chewing food helps to digest food faster.
subQuestions.modelAnswer: Chewing increases the surface area of the food in contact with digestive juice for faster digestion.

short_answer.questionText: Alex and Ben are preparing for a shadow puppet show. Below are the items that have been provided to them to stage the puppet show.

subQuestions.text: (a) They realise that one item is not provided. What is the item?
(b) Give a reason why the cardboard is used to make puppets.
subQuestions.modelAnswer: Cardboard is opaque / does not allow light to pass through.

short_answer.questionText: The diagram below shows a set-up used in a dark room to measure the amount of light that could pass through different materials, P, Q and R.

image.caption: Setup to measure light passing through materials

subQuestions.text: (a) Based on the results, which material P, Q or R, would be most suitable to make part M of the sunglasses? Explain your answer.
subQuestions.modelAnswer: Material Q is translucent / allows some light to pass through.

subQuestions.text: (b) What will happen to the amount of light that passes through if materials P and R are placed together?

short_answer.questionText: Derrick inverted two identical plastic cups, A and B, into a basin of water as shown in the diagram below. He pierced a hole at the base of one of the plastic cups.

image.caption: Plastic cups in a basin of water

subQuestions.text: Based on the results shown above, which plastic cup, A or B, is more likely to have a hole at its base? Explain your answer.
subQuestions.modelAnswer: Plastic cup B. The water level in plastic cup B is same as the basin of water. Some of the air in plastic cup B has escaped through the hole.

short_answer.questionText: Mr Tan filled a container to the brim with marbles as shown in the diagram below. Next, he tried to pour some water into the container.

subQuestions.text: (a) Explain why Mr Tan is able to pour water into the container even though the marbles were filled to the brim.
subQuestions.modelAnswer: There are air spaces / air gaps in between the marbles. Air in between the space escapes and water takes up the space.

subQuestions.text: (b) Besides taking up space, state another property of liquid, which enables the water to be poured into the container of marbles.
